thread.title: Tennessee finishes in top 20 in team rankings
thread.title_full: Tennessee finishes in top 20 in team rankings

title: Tennessee finishes in top 20 in team rankings
text:
Manage Tennessee finishes in top 20 in team rankings A quiet signing day on which Tennessee retained all of its commitments but didn't make any new additions ended with the Vols' class ranked outside the top 15 nationally. Slot to Tennessee Links (Photo: Christopher Hanewinckel) 
Squeezing more than 25 players into its 2017 recruiting class didn't prevent Tennessee from finishing National Signing Day with its lowest-ranked class assembled entirely by coach Butch Jones ' staff. 
A quiet signing day on which the Vols retained all of their commitments but didn't make any new additions to their class ended with Tennessee ranked No. 17 in the 247Sports team recruiting rankings, down three spots from where it started the day. 
The Vols finished with a team score of 236.15, nearly two points ahead of No. 18 Maryland (234.17) and a little more than two points behind No. 16 Clemson (238.31). (What's next for the Vols? Make sure you're in the loop — take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) 
Tennessee, which has 28 commitments in its class — 27 of whom officially have been announced has signees — now is ranked seventh among SEC teams behind Alabama (No. 1), Georgia (No. 3), LSU (No. 7), Auburn (No. 9), Florida (No. 10) and Texas A&M (No. 12) after being overtaken by the Gators on Wednesday. 
The average player rating for the 28 players in the Vols' class is 87.14, which is tied for 21st nationally. 
It's the second consecutive year Tennessee has finished outside the top 10 in the 247Sports team rankings. After signing back-to-back top-seven classes in 2014 and 2015, the Vols dropped to No. 14 with a 23-player class in 2016. 
While Tennessee's class features one five-star prospect, four four-stars and 23 three-stars, according to the 247Sports Composite, the Vols fared better in the rankings based entirely on 247Sports' ratings . According to 247Sports' analysts, Tennessee's class is ranked 11th nationally. BUY ONE MONTH, GET TWO MONTHS FREE to get VIP access to GoVols247. Author
